enWisdom: The envious is disheartened
Jealousy is imprisonment of the soul
Rancour is the seed of evil
Jealousy is the principal of [all] flaws
Faith is free of jealousy
The jealous one is never cured
The jealous one never gains authority
Jealousy is the great trap of the Devil
Jealousy is the habitude of the vile ones and the enemies of fortunes
Jealousy is the viler of the two depravities

Wisdom: الْحَسَدُ عَيْبٌ فَاضِحٌ وَشُحٌّ [شجي‏] فَادِحٌ لَا يَشْفِي صَاحِبَهُ إِلَّا بُلُوغُ آمَالِهِ [أَمَلِهِ‏] فِيمَنْ يَحْسُدُهُ
enWisdom: Jealousy is a shameful flaw and a gross deficiency; one who possesses it is not cured except by realizing his hopes about the one whom he envies

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْحَسَدَ فَإِنَّهُ شَرُّ شِيمَةٍ وَأَقْبَحُ سَجِيَّةٍ وَخَلِيقَةُ إِبْلِيسَ
enWisdom: Be wary of jealousy for it is the worst quality, the ugliest attribute and the trait of the Devil
When jealousy between the people rains, corruption grows

Wisdom: خُلُوُّ الصَّدْرِ مِنَ الْغِلِّ وَالْحَسَدِ مِنْ سَعَادَةِ الْعَبْدِ
enWisdom: Having a heart that is free of rancour and jealousy is from the felicity of a servant
The cornerstone of [all] depravities is jealousy
The weapon of ignobility is jealousy
The worst thing that can accompany a person is jealousy

Wisdom: احْتَرِسُوا مِنْ سَوْرَةِ الْجَمْدِ وَالْحِقْدِ وَالْغَضَبِ وَالْحَسَدِ وَأَعِدُّوا لِكُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنْ ذَلِكَ عُدَّةً تُجَاهِدُونَهُ بِهَا مِنَ الْفِكْرِ فِي الْعَاقِبَةِ وَمَنْعِ الرَّذِيلَةِ وَطَلَبِ الْفَضِيلَةِ وَصَلَاحِ الْآخِرَةِ وَلُزُومِ الْحِلْمِ
enWisdom: Protect yourselves from vehement miserliness, malice, anger and jealousy and prepare for each of these things a contrivance which you can fight it with, like thinking about the consequence, refraining [from] vice, seeking virtue, improving your Hereafter and espousing forbearance
Jealousy is not from the characteristics of the God-wary

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ بِحَالِهِ لَمْ يَعْتَوِرْهُ الْحَسَدُ
enWisdom: One who is pleased with his state will not be affected by jealousy

Wisdom: مَنِ اتَّقَى قَلْبُهُ لَمْ يَدْخُلْهُ الْحَسَدُ
enWisdom: One whose heart is God-wary, jealousy does not enter into it

Wisdom: مِنْ صِغَرِ الْهِمَّةِ حَسَدُ الصَّدِيقِ عَلَى النِّعْمَةِ
enWisdom: Jealousy towards a friend for the blessing [he has been endowed with] stems from low self-esteem

Wisdom: لَا تَكُونُوا لِنِعَمِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ أَضْدَاداً
enWisdom: Do not be adversaries of the blessings of Allah upon you

Wisdom: لَا تَكُونُوا لِفَضْلِ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ حُسَّاداً
enWisdom: Because of the favour of Allah upon you, do not be jealous

Wisdom: لَا تَحَاسَدُوا فَإِنَّ الْحَسَدَ يَأْكُلُ الْإِيمَانَ كَمَا تَأْكُلُ النَّارُ الْحَطَبَ
enWisdom: Do not be jealous of each other, for jealousy eats away the faith like fire consumes firewood; and do not have hatred for one another for this is severing [for the faith]
A believer is never found to be envious, malevolent or miserly
